CPS Asia Newsletter
Jan 17 (10th Issue)

Hi Everyone and Happy 2017 to you and your families !
As we start a new year, a quick reflection on 2016 and look ahead at 2017…
The teams across CPS Asia did a fabulous job to finish 2016 strongly. Despite softer volume in China and India, CPS Asia managed to deliver very good financial results and we over-delivered on some key metrics as our OH/part. We had challenges on Quality and Safety where we have taken the learning and have built stronger processes and focus from all of us for this coming year. A big “Thank You” to all of you who made these results happen !
The year ahead promises to be another exciting year. As we look at our priorities, we can categorize them in the 3 parts of our “3-legged stool”: Driving productivity / Building capability / Strengthening our performance. Productivity is part of how we as a Company approach our activities. In CPS Asia, we have not only delivered very well on this in the past, we have also started to build a pipeline of ideas for the future. On capability, we keep investing in people and will introduce Performance Enablement as a new process. We equally keep investing in our infrastructure with eg. new warehouses opening in Indonesia & Singapore and a new waste water treatment system that will be built in India.
Our performance has strengthened from year to year and I ask for your special attention on Safety and Quality, the 2 most important parts of what we do. In all of this, there will be a lot of new product launches, us supporting the important “Renew Category Growth” project and many other initiatives that will continue to drive our business.
Thanks to all of you for your continued support to our customers ! Look forward to a great year ahead !
Ruddy

A true mark of success is to be able to have a balanced life

Team Pakistan started 2017 with the commitment to deliver outstanding business results by keeping everyone fresh and healthy through their
2017 Health & Well-Being Program!
(Contributed by Faisal Hashmi, HR SBP, CPS Pakistan)

On 25 November 2016, CPS Indonesia held a Women’s LINC Green Activity with the theme “Hydroponics and Recycling”. The activity was facilitated by Production Operator, Guntur Putra Mahendra.
Hydroponics using the Wick System is a very simple and cost efficient method of planting. Recyclable packaging materials such as cans, taste test cups, cardboards, plastic bottles are used to create the nursery. The harvest can be picked 25 to 30 days later.
Associates enjoyed this activity and learnt new skills and knowledge that they can easily implement back at their own homes.
The event ended with cooking yummy fried noodles with their very own pak coy harvest !
(Contributed by Sri Majangwinarni, Women’s LINC Steering Com, CPS Indonesia)

CPS India celebrated Family Day on 2nd December, 2016.
Associates and their families enjoyed the food and various activities that were organized. There was also a Tattoo Artist, Stilt Walker, Cartoon Characters, and even a Photo Booth where photos were printed on mugs as take-away gifts for family members.
Dr. Mugdha Vartak, a well-known gynecologist in Pune, was invited to give a talk to the ladies on common female health and well-being topics.
Winners of the CPS India Sports Week were announced, and members of Team Ajinkya were recognized for their excellent performance in the Step Challenge.
Mr. Sandeep Boralkar addressed and thanked family members for their support and contribution towards the company. He also thanked the members of Womens LINC for making this event such a successful one.
The CPS India Team looks forward to more of such events in the future!
(Contributed by Martin Joseph, HR SBP, CPS India)

In December 2016, CPS Asia through Asia Procurement Manager and CPS Canlubang Plant Custodian, Eleanor L. Mitra, sponsored a simple yet fun year-end party for the in-house contractors from various service providers working at Canlubang facility.
This is our way of sharing happiness and expressing gratitude for the loyalty, dedication and great service these men have been providing CPS Canlubang through the years after the plant ceased its manufacturing operations in 2013.
The half-day event started with lunch, followed by giving of raffle prizes, grocery gifts and Coca-Cola gift packs. The party was capped off with an enjoyable videoke singing activity.
The team well appreciated the thoughtfulness of the Management and were delighted with the goodies that they took home to their families for their Christmas Noche Buena.
(Contributed by Eleanor L. Mitra, Procurement Manager, CPS Asia)

With the rollout of the Food Safety Modernization Act (FSMA), the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) requires US-FDA registered facilities to implement preventive controls in human and animal food.
CPS Singapore, Indonesia and Pakistan jointly organized and attended the Preventive Control Qualified Individual (PCQI) Training on 4-6 Jan 2017 which was held in CPS Singapore.
The facilitator from DNV GL, Wendy Yap, engaged the participants with fun activities to enhance the learning experience and ensure that participants were equipped with the necessary competency to perform proper implementation and verification of the additional controls.
(Contributed by Gabriel Ng, Process QA Manager, CPS Singapore)

Whilst 2016 had been a successful year, 2017 is another exciting year for CPS Singapore.  On 12th December 2016, the team had an away-day to review the 2016 accomplishments and discuss the 2017 business plan, including the key drivers to deliver the 2017 WIGs.  The session was held at Raffles Marina, a very charming Yacht Club which is minutes away from the Plant.
In the first half of the morning, the Plant Leadership Team cascaded the 2017 Business Plans to all associates – as all BP Sessions would do. The integral part of the Business Planning process was the discussion with associates to capture their thoughts and inputs on the Plant WIGs.  This was done through cross-functional group discussions of 10 – 12 associates, facilitated by the management team.  After the very yummy lunch, the afternoon was focused on departmental break-out sessions for objective setting and alignment discussions within respective teams.
Another exciting year awaits the Can-lah! Team and we can only be successful if we have aligned goals and clear information – which was achieved by this event on December 12th.
(Contributed by Pearlie Galina, HR SBP, CPS Singapore)

CPS Shanghai kicked off their first Lunch and Learn and session in Y2017 on Jan. 18th.
Jenny Yao Harrison, PAC Tea Category & Application Leader was the invited guest speaker at this session.
Jenny gave the participants an overall introduction to the R & D function, which included:
– Global R&D Vision and Mission
– Asia Pacific R&D Strategic Priorities and Organization
– Tea & Infusions Innovation as an example – to understand the Operating Model and how we work
Jenny also inspired the team through the sharing of her 20 years career experience at The Coca-Cola Company where she worked in 5 Business Units from different countries.
This learning event marks a great start to the year for the team to share, learn and exchange valuable knowledge with expertise within the system. Let’s continue to share happiness and strengthen the learning spirit throughout the year!
(Contributed by Grace Ge, Assistant HR Manager, CPS Shanghai)

CPS Singapore Supply Chain office has moved across the street to the new ASRS Building!
All are welcome to drop by for a visit!
(Contributed by Lynette Leong, Supply Chain Manager, CPS Singapore)

Maggie Ma moved from CPS Shanghai to join CPS Singapore as Finance Manager as of 1st January 2017.

Find out what she has to say about her recent move to Singapore…

What were your main considerations in your move to Singapore?
“Although I’ve visited Singapore a few times, I’ve never thought about moving to this beautiful city with my family until the opportunity in CPS Singapore came along. It was not a difficult decision for me, mainly because during our first personal trip to Singapore 4 years ago, my family and I had a great impression about the cleanliness and efficiency of this country. From my perspective, Singapore and Shanghai are very alike. Both cities value efficiency and equity. Both cities have diversified religion and culture. Most important point for parents—both cities believe that education matters.

Any thoughts about your new home in Singapore so far?
So far, I’ve been in our new home for more than 3 weeks. I feel energized and excited still, because everyday I meet different people and experience the different cultures. I really love the team here—including our plant leadership team as well as our finance community. They have been very supportive!

“SRI LANKA, The Pearl of the Indian Ocean
I can definitely say, SRI LANKA is a beautiful country.
Soon it will be one of the more hectic and busy travel destinations in the world, especially for mountain trekkers, tea lovers, surfers, and curry-holics. Kind people, cool weather in the mountains, hot sunny beaches, sweet fresh fruits, wild animals, and nice tea everywhere!
It was my first experience on a real BACKPACKING trip for 10 days 8 nights and walked 10,000+ STEPS a day! I couldn’t stop walking and going forward to see the different views in Sri Lanka. There are lovely green trees in the mountains, and gentle but strong blue waves for surfing. It is also culturally open. Even though Buddhism is prevalent, the biggest Christmas tree was set at Colombo city.
Only one weak point was transportation. Few highways prevented me from moving to other cities fast. Slow train (but cheap), bumpy bus (but very cheap), tuk-tuk (negotiable), and less private taxis (expensive but comfortable). With Google map and comfortable shoes, it is still worth the trip!
Any specific recommendations? Here you go..
Sigiriya Lion Fortress, Blue Field Tea Plantation, Horton Plains National Park, Weligama Beach”
(Contributed by Hee Soo Kim, General Admin Manager/ Finance Assistant, CPS Korea)

CPS Asia Newsletter
November 2016


Securely Tied in Green Belt

CPS Singapore started the first 11-session Green Belt training since August which ended in October. The program was facilitated by the OE Manager and co-facilitated by the Plant Manager, Operations, Function Managers and Human Resources.

Participants applied the learnings on problem solving and process improvement with in depth analysis to their Green Belt projects…

– Integrated Resources into Scheduling for KO Liquid Batching and Filling
– Integrated Resource into Scheduling for Piggyback
– QA Resource and Process Optimization
– Identification of Inner Parts
– PBS filler optimization
– Monthly Sales Volume Alignment

(Contributed by Phang Kum Kong, Operational Excellence Manager, CPS Singapore)

Process Optimization, Quality and Safety Focus in CPS India

“It was an honor to have Bernard McGuinness, CPS Director, Process Optimization, Quality & Safety in CPS India for 2 days – on 17 and 18 October 2016. The team was delighted to have the opportunity to share the improvements completed during the year, plant tour, review the GAO audit observations on the shop floor and visited both the existing Waste Water Treatment Plant and the proposed new site for WWTP with Bernard. He also spent quality time with the QSE team on the progress of the Lab, ESLP and MDM work streams. Other key topics discussed include the new laboratory design, 2017 projects and expectations on QSE Business Planning processes. And of course he did not forget testing some Coke products including those new ethnic products from competitors before leaving the plant”.

(Contributed by Milind Joshi, Process QA Manager, CPS India)

3rd Cohort for STEP 2 in Singapore

Specifically designed to strengthen the capabilities of Frontline People Managers, as their success in managing self, managing others, and managing the business are crucial in helping us achieve our 2020 vision, the STEP 2 Workshop for our 3rd cohort was conducted in Raffles Marina in Singapore from 25 Oct to 28 Oct 2016.

This training was a collaboration between CPS Asia and Bottling Investment Group (BIG), Singapore/Malaysia. A total of 27 Frontline People Managers from the various plants participated in this 3 ½ day workshop, facilitated by Perle Dragon, Master Facilitator from CPS Asia together with Sabrina Zainal and Vincent Bouw (both from BIG). Congratulations to all participants!

(Contributed by Perle Dragon, Capability Development and Change Manager, CPS Asia)

World Class Technology in Waste Water Treatment

“Rudi Sueys, CPS Sustainability & ESLP Manager, was in CPS India from 4 to 7 October 2016 to select a world class technology for our new Waste Water Treatment Plant (WWTP). In India, environmental protection regulations are becoming more stringent every year and there is a need to upgrade our existing 22 years old WWTP to meet the regulatory requirements. It has also been decided to relocate the WWTP from BIG to CPS premises. The CPS India team and Rudi spent ½ day with each of the shortlisted vendors to fully understand the technology, specifications, costs and expected outcomes as part of the vendor evaluation and selection process. The team evaluated the technology options with detailed analysis with Rudi before the final vendor selection. Before leaving, there was a tree planting ceremony by Rudi to support our commitment to protecting the environment”.

(Contributed by Milind Joshi, Process QA Manager, CPS India)

CPS Japan Supply Chain Team Bonding on Samba Dinner & Fun Quiz

“On 17 November 2016, CPS Japan Supply Chain Team in Tokyo came together for a Samba dinner. Tomohiko Yamaguchi who is based in KOWC on Kyushu Island (more than 1100km away from Tokyo) joined the event too. The team actively participated in the team challenge – “Ultra Personnel Quiz” while enjoying a nice Brazilian barbeque at Churrasco. The winning team won a Coke Name Tag each and the rest received some consolation prizes too.

After the Samba show, the dancers presented a birthday cake to Tadashi Koseki (Director of CPS Japan Supply Chain). It was planned as a surprise for him! The evening was filled with great food, great fun and lots of laughter, and importantly we had a great time bonding with each other!”

(Contributed by Shigeru Uchida, Inventory Analysis Manager, CPS Japan)

Wellness in Cancer Awareness

Breast Cancer is one of the most common cancer in women worldwide. Pakistan has one of the highest incidence of breast cancer in Asia. The best way to fight this cancer is to detect it early and start appropriate treatment. Over and above to this, it is important to provide awareness to women about this deadly disease.

As part of our Women’s LINC & Associate Well-Being initiatives, we organized a very powerful joint event for our female associates from CCI Pakistan bottling, CPS Plant and Region office. The session will be held on 31 October at 26-FCC Gulberg, Lahore where the participants had the opportunity to interact with famous Women Health Specialist, Dr. Noreen Zafar Gold Medalist and Ms. Najma Sikander, a brave survivor of breast cancer.

(Contributed by Faisal Hashmi, Strategic HR Business Partner, CPS Pakistan)

Festival of Lights in CPS Singapore

CPS Singapore celebrated Deepavali on 4 November 2016 for the associates especially the Hindus. As Singapore is a multi-racial and multi-religion country, it is one significant occasion that will always be celebrated. The staff were invited to have Indian buffet lunch and dinner (for 2nd shift associates). One key dish for lunch is the piping hot Roti Prata (a fried flatbread that is flipped many times over a flat grill till cooked). It is usually served with curry and it is a favourite dish in both Malaysia and Singapore.

Deepavali, which is also known as the festival of lights is a colorful festival that is celebrated by all Hindus worldwide. One important practice that the Hindus follow during the festival is to light oil lamps in their homes on Deepavali morning to give thanks to the God for the happiness, knowledge, peace and wealth that they have received.

Women Leadership Awareness

CPS Korea organized a 1-day Women’s LINC workshop on women leadership.

“I really appreciate this event. There is still an opportinity to increase gender diversity for leadership roles in Korea and this event certainly has increased this awareness and supported women associates taking leadership positions”, said Ji Ae Li, Production Associate.

“I am really impressed to learn about how various experiences can make life so fulfilling. I learnt that it is very important to build inner strength through studying curious fields, travel round the world and build up various relationships from diverse cultures”, said Ye Jin Chun, Production Associate from CPS Korea. Overall, the participants learnt valuable knowledge to make their steps forward and to draw the power from inside them. (Contributed by Ji Ae Lee and Ye Jin Chun)

White Affair at Mambo Beach Club

White-Affair was the theme for the CPS Singapore year-end party, held at the Mambo Beach Club in Sentosa on 12 November 2016. The Ambassador Committee members handed everyone a special array of party accessories and coke premiums as door-gifts as associates arrived in their ‘white-ever’ attires. A hearty feast was enjoyed by all in a perfect evening under the stars with a beach back-drop and acoustic entertainment (presented by some members of the team). One of the highlights of the evening was the service awards given out to associates, providing the opportunity to recognize our associates for their dedication and valued contribution to The Coca-Cola Company. The evening was filled with excitement, fun, appreciation and laughter when the associates played games and danced the night away. A true testament that the “Can Lah!” team works hard and party harder!

(Contributed by Pearlie Galina, HR SBP, CPS Singapore)

Halloween Frights & Treats

CPS Japan held a Halloween event under the collaboration of　Women’s LINC and Moriyama Ambassador committee. The entrance and corridors were decorated in lively and festive mood. As Halloween events are getting popular in Japan despite the fact that people do not know the originality of Halloween, CPS Japan created a learning Wikipedia as fun sharing.

The organizers packed and decorated various Halloween treats (small snacks) and distributed them to all employees and staffs at lunch time. The team also enjoyed dressing up with fancy costumes and took lots of photos.

(Contributed by Yumiko Yamaga, HR Strategic Business Partner, CPS Japan)

Flattering Day on International Men’s Day

On 17 November 2016, CPS Singapore celebrated International Men’s Day for all males associates by organizing a self-confidence workshop for them. The invited professional speaker Julia Aw provided an interesting 1-hour session on first impression touching topics such as how to find the flattering colours to wear according to skin tone, basic skin care tips on reducing dark circles and wrinkles, face cleansing, confidence and poise etc.

“I get to learn how to wash my face thoroughly using the correct technique, so I shall be feeling good and smelling great every day!” chuckled James Poh, Operations Technician, CPS Singapore.

Min Seok Ko’s Solo Visit to LAOS

“LAOS is becoming a popular tourist place among Koreans, especially after the famous TV program “Youth Over Flowers” was broadcasted. I was on a solo journey but never a moment of dullness. At Vang Vieng city, I headed to the “Blue Lagoon” on a scooter to enjoy the beautiful sceneries around me. The emerald colored lake was a popular swimming pool where tourist freely dived into the water from the nearby trees. Kayaking, Jeep line, cave tubing in this natural forested place were some unforgettable experiences. After 3 days, I moved to “Luang Prabang” (UNESCO World Heritage) known for its unique and remarkably well preserved architectural, religious and cultural heritage. It was interesting to see hundreds of monks from the various monasteries walking through the streets collecting alms early in the morning. The people were kind and provided great hospitality to me. I enjoyed my tour and highly recommend this journey to anyone who likes life outside the busy city!”

(Contributed by Min Seok Ko, CPS Korea)

Share Your Story & Help Us Grow

This is the 9th issue of newsletter. In order for us to “grow” and improvise, we would like to seek your feedback. Please share your comments to pdragon@coca-cola.com.

Wished that you could share your stories with colleagues in CPS Asia? Wondering how to tell to more people? Now, you can! Contribute to “Travelog ABCD” or “Yours Truly” columns. We look forward to you sharing your story here…

CPS Asia Newsletter
October 2016


The Story behind “Coke Beats”

Life begins with a beat, that is our heart beat. Every beat keeps us alive.  Beat takes us through the years and gives us the rhythm of life in everything we do, at work and at play. “Coke Beats” from our heart and bring the rhythmic feel in everyone of us in Coca Cola. Every beat makes it possible for us to move forward, live another day and rejuvenate us. The continuous flow of CPS Asia news and events keep us energized, focused, motivated and happy… tapping our feet to the beats everyday!

(Contributed by Juliet Fernandes, Assistant Manager Scheduling, CPS India who gave our newsletter this name “Coke Beats”)


Juliet Fernandes
The Lady behind “Coke Beats”

Juliet Fernandes , a name that I am familiar with because she is always supportive in the newsletter. This shows her personal commitment and her interest to be involved in things outside her job scope. Her friends describe her as someone with strong family values and someone who can be leaned on during crisis. I am not surprised. Personally I like her the moment I got to know her. She is an amazing lady who has a heart of gold. Despite her heavy workload, she finds time in social work and supports poor children actively in their education and medical care. Bravo to you, Juliet!

When I asked Juliet about how she got the name “Coke Beats”, she told me that her 24 years of service with Coca-Cola has given her good insights – on the way the Company cares for the customers and the amount of safety measures that were built into our products. All these made her really proud to be part of the Coca-Cola family. Her pride is in her heart beats – these beats create the rythmn that energizes and inspires her to be at her best everyday- for herself and for others.


Information Security and Protection at our Shop Floor

“In Asia we started our journey  to protect our shop floor environment from Cyber-attacks/ threats  to ensure that we eliminate risk and disruptions to our manufacturing environment.  Around Q2 this year we have completed the on-site assessment of our Plants and designed the solutions.  We are happy to share that Moriyama is the first plant in Asia to implement ICS solution successfully during last week of Sep 16.  The whole project went on smoothly without a single issue after the go-live.  I would like to specially thank Takahashi-san, Saito-san for their support along with Global IT Team to make it happen. The deployment for Singapore, Shanghai & India Plant is in progress and will be completed by end of this year.”

(Contributed by Sudhir Dixit, IT Governance Director)


8 Sept 2016
Collaboration & Training from INSWA Leaders in CPS India

CPS India and INSWA BU collaborated to deliver the 2016 and 2017 plans. INSWA BU leaders, Sunil Gulati (Vice President, Technical) and Devdas Baliga (Vice President, Legal) visited the CPS Pune Plant. The CPS team shared with them the current status and future plans on customer service, meeting volume challenges, quality expectations, improvements in practices on Governance and also people initiatives. Other key points during the discussion wer Business continuity plan, water availability, waste water treatment plan for phase one and phase two.  Devdas Baliga in return, delivered training on Ethic and Compliance to the team and the day ended with great learning and achieving its purpose.

(Contributed by Milind Joshi, Process QA Manager, CPS India)


23 Sept 2016
Creative Minds Come Together For Second Time in CPS Shanghai

18 frontline people managers came gathered together with their creative ideas and experiences and happiness and took away more leadership skills to deliver business results after completing a STEP 2 workshop.

Business leaders – Cindy Ye (Plant Manager of CPS Shanghai), Alphe Zhang (General Manager of BIG Franchise) and Sean Song (CPS Asia Special Project Manager) were with the team to inspire their learning. Message from Cindy: “Be persistent with the objectives that you have set to achieve; influence others with your passion and continue to build trust to achieve our common goals.”

The participants enjoyed the scenario learning as they were interesting and practical in real life context.

(Contributed by Grace Ge, Assistant HR Manager, CPS Shanghai)


19 – 21 Oct 2016
Asia Productivity Workshop in Shanghai

Representatives from BU, CPS and R&D made up the productivity community convened last October 19 in Shanghai for the Asia Productivity Workshop. As one technical team, we have reviewed 2016 productivity results and productivity strategy, shared best practice and ideas which led to the generation of a refreshed 3-year productivity pipeline for each of the Asia Pacific Business Units.

The Productivity Workshop was followed by the first ever formal Asia CPS-R&D Face-to-Face Meeting where both CPS and R&D shared the goals and strategies, with focus on the 3-year innovation pipeline. Opportunities to partner as solutions providers to the business units were also discussed so as to have early engagement between CPS and R&D.

(Contributed by Milette Dela Cruz, Product Commercialization Specialist, CPS Asia)


19 – 21 Oct 2016
Harmonic Charity from CPS Korea

Some 9 associates from CPS Korea participated in a charity concert in good intention to help raise scholarship fund for the orphans. The concert was organized by Happy Tree Plus corporation to provide educational opportunities for orphans for further education so as to increase their independency.

“We love the grand philharmonic orchestra and the choirs. They are so musically talented. The amazing fact is these orchestra and choirs are run from donations!” said Jina Kim, Master Production Scheduler from CPS Korea. “It was also a meaning evening for us to appreciate excellent master pieces of music, enriching our soul and mind.” chuckled Min Seok Ko, Production Associate, CPS Korea, who is also the contributor of this article.


21 Oct 2016
Well-Being in Competing and Eating Well in CPS Korea

“We had a “2016 CCKC Well-Being Day” at Yang-Pyung glamping site. Each associate became an “owner of Coke Restaurant” and had to cook up a Coke & Meal Combo. The morning breeze rejuvenated these Coke ambassadors in their full spirit to compete. Early morning, the teams competed through physical games to win coins to buy ingredients. Each team was given about 50 minutes to cook up “Coke meals” and soon, the 3 long tables were filled with scrumptious and palatable food. Celebrity Chefs Lee Jin Ho and Shin Hyo Seob interviewed each team and selected Joonghyun and Jina’s team as winners. This Coke Well-being Day was really fun and fulfilling”.

(Contributed by Hee Soo Kim, Admin Manager/ Finance Assistant, CPS Korea)


With Hee Soo Kim
On Her Short Term Assignment in Singapore

Hee Soo Kim (Admin Manager/Finance Assistant, CPS Korea) was in Singapore for 5 months on a Short Term Assignment from 16 May to 7 October. Find out what she has to say on her learnings…

One Interesting Fact of Singapore?
“Singapore is like a BIBIMBAP – a Korean food, rice with mixed vegetable. Different cultures are well combined and harmonized but each of them has its own spirit and uniqueness. CPS Singapore has 15 different nationalities. “Where are you from?” was the usual meeting question”.

Key Learning Point and Advice to Others?
“Very busy, fruitful and most valuable, I learnt how to make decision and think interactively, facilitate discussion, and take on greater responsibility. Stay curious on new things. You will be surprised that there are many interesting things around us”.


Faisal Hashmi’s
Journey to Rio

“It was very pleasant knowing that I have been selected for a VIP trip to Rio. Going to Rio was a dream and Coca-Cola converted this dream into reality. All the arrangements including matches were beyond expectations. Rio was well crowded with people from various countries who came for Olympics. It is an amazing city with lot of beaches, famous mountains, rich history and culture. The general perception about safety and security was not good but I walked a lot even in their old areas but found that people in Rio were very supportive and friendly.

The Ahaa moment was bicycling along the Ipanema beach, enjoying with the fresh Brazilian nuts and meeting lots of Coke family members. Thank you Coca-Cola for providing me this great opportunity!”

(Contributed by Faisal Hashmi, HR Strategic Business Partner, CPS Pakistan)


Fun Quiz

Guess Where?
Can You Guess which Plant is this in the photo?

– CPS Moriyama Plant?
– CPS Singapore Plant?
– CPS Shanghai?

1. Send only ONE entry per associate to kelzaphang@coca-cola.com
2. Please state “My answer is X ”
3. 5 lucky winners with the correct entries will get a prize.
4. Deadline is 28 November 2016, 5pm Singapore time.

CPS Asia Newsletter
September 2016


September 12 – 16
CPS Leaders’ Talking Points in Atlanta

The CPS Leadership Team met in Atlanta not only to review the 2016 Rolling Estimate but also to understand the commitment in the 2017 plan and to have a discussion of observations and follow-up actions following our Vice President, Darlene Nicosia’s plant visits. The leadership team also joined in team building skills based on “The Advantage”: by Patrick Lencioni.

Additional agenda on the table was the creation of our future vision based on the theme of “Setting the future for CPS as TCCC Renews Category Growth” with efforts grounded on the business realities, and voice of the customer work.

Plans to ensure delivery of 2016 and 2017 results included putting in business travel restrictions, having on-going capital expense reviews, implementing cost control processes, having hiring process for non-operational roles and setting new productivity targets.

Cohesively, the global leaders also agreed on an updated CPS mission statement, definition of 3 key leadership behaviors (Collaboration, Integrity and Accountability) and the 3 strategic anchors (Executional Excellence, Cost Optimization and Collaboration) for CPS.


September 20 – 21
Planning Integration Workshop with ASEAN Business Unit and CPS Singapore

This much awaited Planning Integration workshop with ASEAN Business Unit Supply Chain, Commercialization, Finance and CPS Singapore finally materialized after 2 years of envision. The key objective of the 2-day workshop was to have better understanding of the current end-to-end processes on Rolling Estimate, the New Product Development process and to share key challenges encountered across the different entities and functions. Despite the tight meeting schedule, the team was able to align processes and jointly defined the future state through in-depth discussion and collaboration.

“In the near future, the team will expect improved forecast accuracy to ensure a more stable production and ingredient requirements. With this Workshop, CPS Singapore showcased the different projects we are working on, our unrelenting efforts to respond to dynamic demand and to mitigate exposure was greatly recognized by the Business Units. Well done, CPS Singapore!”, said Jocelyn Lim, Demand Analyst, CPS Singapore and also the contributor of this article.


September 12 – 15
CPS Japan’s first STEP in 3 ½ day

This STEP training conducted in CPS Japan was the 4th cohort in Asia since its launch in October 2015 in collaboration with Coca-Cola Bottler and our global learning partners. 15 participants went through 3 ½ -day with our in-house Master Facilitator, Perle Dragon and Noriko Maeda from Vantage Partners. The STEP is designed to strengthen the capabilities of our Frontline People Managers, as their success in managing self, managing others and managing business are crucial to effectively execute their day-to-day responsibilities to achieve our 2020 vision. Participants will be coming back for STEP 2 session in the 1st quarter 2017.


August 8 – 12
CPS India Conquered Audit in One Team Spirit

CPS India has undergone auditing by the Global Audit Organization (in short GAO) in their Pune plant in 3 areas – Quality, Safety and Environment. The key objective was to bring a systematic, disciplined approach to evaluate and improve the effectiveness of current processes, including risk management, control and governance. The audit scope included all quality, safety and environmental processes in compliance to the standards and regulations under Coca-Cola Operating Requirements (KORE).

The team together with the GAO auditors worked through the 5 full days, confirming processes, verifying records, interviewing associates, interacting with relevant members and looking at evidences.

A list of preventive and directive suggestions and practical actions were compiled with the objective to have continual improvements in governance and efficiency. The plant demonstrated an “audit ready culture” with great team spirit. The team celebrated this achievement with a get-together session, followed by a group dinner. (Contributed by Milind Joshi, Process Control Head, CPS India).


August 29
“Bring in that 7 Habits please !”

About 15 participants attended the 7 Habits Foundations Workshop that was conducted in Singapore.

This 1-day workshop was facilitated by internal certified facilitators – Mauricio Avalos, Vanessa Yuen and Perle Dragon.

It was a very enriching session where participants were challenged to reflect on their own lives and how they could achieve personal and interpersonal effectiveness by living the 7 Habits of Highly Effective People.


August 8 – 19
CPS Indonesia High in “Numero Uno” Spirit for Well-Being

58 associates were in high “Numero Uno” Spirit competing in 3 games – Futsal, Badminton and Billard and had Mountain Biking. Though these well-being activities were organized to celebrate Indonesia’s 71st Independence Day, the key objective was also to build strong fellowship, unity, dependence and collaboration through competitive games. “We love the fun and togetherness. We are always so busy working and hardly have time to interact.

These activities build team spirit, We should do this again next year and perhaps we should also invite the associates from the Business Unit to join us!” said Cahyo Bintoro, the Well-Being Champion of CPS Indonesia.


August 13 – 14
Durian Craving from Singapore to Segamat Durian Plantation

About 20 die-hard durian lovers went on a 2-day durian fulfilment before heading to Malacca for shopping. Durian is regarded in South East Asia as the “king of fruits” and is distinctive for its large size, strong flavour and formidable thorn-covered husk. trip. Some people regard the durian as having a pleasantly sweet fragrance; others find the aroma overpowering with an unpleasant odour.

“We love the companionship, the outing and ate to our heart’s content! We look forward to another trip like this!”, said Jessie Ang, Warehouse Assistant and contributor of photos.


September 2
Men In Aprons Cooked Up Fun in CPS Korea

About 30 associates cooked up Braised Spicy Short Ribs, Sweet and Sour Pork and Braised Spicy Chicken completed with side dishes. The cooking competition was spiced up with sensor tests, puzzles and speed contests to obtain the needed ingredients. The objective of Cooking Up Fun was to promote teamwork and to acquire independent food skills that support healthy eating. The winning team should score high on decoration, teamwork and creativity. Lunch was all the food that was cooked on the table.

The afternoon was spent watching 1 of the 3 famous Korean movies (1.Gukje Market, 2.Veteren and 3.Haeundae) of their choice, followed by a 1-hour talk by Seung-jae Lee, a Journalist and Movie Reviewer. Lee taught the team on film appreciation especially on the genre of the movies and the dialogues. The afternoon ended with a discussion on practical application of the movie dialogues to real life and of course awarding the top prize to our top chef !


September 16
Stretched to the Limit in CPS Japan for Well-Being

A day of Well-Being Yoga and Aerobics brought great mental, physical, emotional and even spiritual benefits that helped our associates kept their mind sharp and a greater ability to focus and multi-task. This event was a joint effort by the Moriyama Ambassador Committee, Labor Safety, Hygiene and Environmental Committee, Plant Leadership Team and Volunteers. The day started with 3 wellness classroom sessions on Anger Management, Sleep Management and the Importance of Understanding Oneself. The Anger Management session gave good tips on thinking clearly and managing frustrations in a non-confrontational way while the Sleep Management session provided a good understanding on sleeping patterns and how to deal with sleeping disorders. The meaningful day ended with a relaxing and fun group barbeque party.


September 15
Mid-Autumn Festival

The Mid-Autumn Festival is a harvest festival celebrated by ethnic Chinese, Koreans and Vietnamese. The festival is held on the 15th day of the 8th month of the lunar calendar. This year, it falls on the 15th September. You will observe that the moon was bright and full on that night. As the round shape symbolizes unity in the Chinese culture, the full moon stirs the ancient sentiments of unity.

In the past, families would get together to make offerings of osmanthus-flavoured wine, spherical fruits like pears, pomegranates and of course mooncakes to the heavens, to express gratitude for a bumper harvest as well as enjoy a reunion with relatives who live far away. Today, friends and loved ones still gather to celebrate together in delight eating the moon cakes and appreciating the spectacular beauty of the full moon.

It is impossible not to notice mooncakes, which was believed to have originated from Yuan dynasty (1271–1368) revolutionaries. It was rumored that assassinators used these pastries to pass secret messages between each other.(/span>

Traditionally, mooncakes are infused with embedded egg yolks and lotus seed paste, but today, you can find many exciting jumble of creative fillings that send your taste buds on a dizzying tour! Besides eating moon cakes, this festival is also celebrated with fire dragon dance, lantern exhibitions, carnivals, stage shows, fortune readings, games and lantern riddle quizzes. Regardless how the festival is celebrated, it is one of the most important festivals. Korea has 3 days of holidays and Vietnamese see this as 2nd most important holiday tradition after the “Tet”.


Ashish Talwalkar in Superstar Gemini

“It was my first experience with my family to be on board the Superstar Gemini, a 230-metre long cruise ship. We embarked on a 3-night cruise to Penang and Kuala Lumpur from Singapore. The ship is well equipped with recreational, fitness facilities and restaurants that serve huge buffets. No wonder cruises have a reputation for non-stop eating! Cruising is not all about the ship and non stop entertainment, it is also enjoying the nature of the big ocean and meeting different people on board. Our cruise ship berthed in Kuala Lumpur and we had the chance to admire the architecture of the majestic Petronas Twin Towers. The breathtaking views of the city from the 276 meter high observation deck of Menara KL Towers was something we cannot forget too.

The stop at Penang island was enjoyable too. The entire long beach front was really picturesque. Penang is a cosmopolitan city with many luxury homes and skyscrapers but the interior part of Penang is very conservative and modest. It is like 2 different sides of the same coin. We roamed the vibrant Gurney Drive studded with its high end malls, shops and restaurants; and also its bazaar that sells anything and everything you could ever need from clothes, shoes to kitchenware, accessories and from local tropical fruits to Penang food.

Lots of people thronged the place during day and night for shopping and eating. Last of all, don’t worry about the getting sea sick. Large modern cruise ships are built with stabilizers to reduce rocking. My family loved the cruise. It was a great break and escape from the hassles and chores of busy life. I must say it was awesome!”


Help Us Grow….

content.rendered:
CPS Asia Newsletter
August 2016


August 12
“Honour the Past and Embrace the Future”

*CPS Shanghai celebrated 28th anniversary with 170 associates

“We had a wonderful time and we took great pride to be a member of this CPS family. Everyone was energized and had real fun. We enjoyed the dancing, quizzes and interactive games”, said Nancy Meng, Strategic HR Business Partner.

The memorable day started with Ruddy Sterckx, CPS Asia General Manager extending his congratulatory video message thanking the associates for their contributions and achievements and encouraging them to keep going and find opportunities for improvement. Linda Zhang, Technical VP of Greater China & Korea (BU) and Nola Yu, Director of APTC also delivered inspiring speeches to the team and expressing their pride in working in CPS Shanghai. The team celebrated the day with sense of glory, pride and ended on a high note with full confidence for the future and of course, not forgetting to recognize the star performing associates.


August 16
CPS Pakistan achieved Integrated Management System Certification for ISO 9001, ISO 14001, FSSC 22000 and OHSAS 18001

“This achievement clearly indicates the commitment of all associates and this progressive commitment has contributed to its success”, said Muhd Makshoof, CPS Pakistan Plant Manager.

(contributed by Asra Farooq)

CPS Pakistan has achieved the re-certification for Integrated Management Systems in August. 8 auditors from SGS completed a full system audits within 5 days. “It was indeed challenging to complete 3 systems audit at one go but is a good trade off to reduce the number of audits at the plant. Challenging indeed but worth the while to reduce the number of annual audits at the plant.”

At the start of the year, the plant started to instill audit awareness culture and made preparation for the audit. Pre-audit preparation work included taking corrective and preventive actions on key issues, identifying gaps and putting in constructive plans to ensure zero non-compliances, emphasizing on Good Manufacturing Practices, Food Safety, Contractor Management, Electrical Safety and providing refresher trainings continuously on the shop floor.


July 15
CPS Korea Operational Excellence Workshop with Bottler SCM

CPS Korea Supply Chain and Bottler Supply Chain Management jointly organized the workshop with the objective to improve current processes and to find opportunities in planning, order management and customer service.

“It was great time spent to drive engagement and share operational excellence concepts to the bottler”, said Jina Kim, Master Production Scheduler, CPS Korea. Wook Jung, Supply Chain Manager agreed, “Although we have current routines with the bottler, it was not enough to challenge higher target and promotes standardization. This 1 day workshop gave us the opportunity to review and analyze the current processes, define root causes, identify gaps and opportunities”.

Key outcome was that the team agreed on actions such as managing 13 weeks forecast to drive standardization and developing inventory policies based on aligned product segmentation for productivity improvement.

After the workshop, the 2 teams continued to network via a group dinner that further helped build working relationship and understanding between the members.

(contributed by Wook Jung)


July 7
CPS India’s full swing in corporate social responsibility

CPS India went full swing in its corporate social responsibility at the plant. The Pune team celebrated its 23rd Foundation Day by organizing a Blood Donation Drive in collaboration with the Poona Hospital & Research. The blood donation drive got marvelous response from our associates – more than 50 pints of blood was donated.

“Being a 1st time donor, I realized it is one of the best feelings and biggest gift given to the mankind” said Rajani Hebbalkar from Customer Service.

John Mathews from Finance agreed “It is also my first time and I feel it is a wonderful experience that I am able to help somebody in distress”.

(contributed by Anupama Singh)


Let’s all Be Well Together!

Wonder who are these awesome Coca-Cola Ambassadors? Guess no more…. they are none other than our Associate Well-Being Champions in CPS Asia!

They are a network of passionate Well-Being advocates with a shared vision of inspiring, promoting and supporting the activation of Coca-Cola’s Associate Well-Being strategies and initiatives in our workplaces across CPS Asia. Thank you for organizing so many exciting, fun and socially engaging initiatives and programs in our locations – helping associates improve and maintain their well-being, and live an active healthy lifestyle. Thumbs Up!

“Well-Being is about each of us — our goals, passions and happiness. It’s what happens when we take action to do the things that help us grow and discover new ways to be our best everyday!” said Vanessa Yuen, Sponsor of CPS Asia AWB Champion Network.


July 19 – 22
STEP 1 Workshop in Singapore with Bottling Investment Group

31 participants from CPS Asia, Pakistan Business Unit and Bottling Investment Group (Singapore and Malaysia) attended a joint training session on STEP 1 in Singapore from 19 to 22 July. This was the first collaborated efforts made by CPS Asia with the Bottling Investment Group and certainly will be the start of many more such trainings in the future.

There were lots of great learning and sharing of people management experiences during the 3 ½ day STEP 1 Workshop between the participants. The group will be coming back in Oct 2016 for the STEP 2 in Singapore again.

(contributed by Perle Dragon)


July 4 – 10
“Dad, Where are we going?”

Inspired by the popular variety show, Zhang Qing took his 5-year old boy to green haven, Hulunbuir

Located in the north-east of Inner Mongolia and named after Hulun Lake and Buir Lake, Hulunbuir Grassland is one of the three famous grasslands in the world with an elevation of between 650 and 700 meters, an area of about 100,000 square meters and natural grassland coverage of 80%. A vast region with beautiful scenery, lush plants, over 3,000 crisscrossed rivers and 500 lakes dotted around， Hulun Buir Prairie is like a huge green picture scroll, which gives you boundless views. It is the most well preserved grassland at present in China and has more than 120 kinds of pasture such as stipa, alfalfa and wheat grass, hence being known as “The Grass Kingdom“.

“It was a first time experience for my son and my friend’s boy to be in such nature, away from the busy and polluted city”, said Zhang Qing, Quality System Manager from CPS Shanghai.

The self-drive holiday gave lots of flexibility to explore the beautiful grassland and green pastures. They also had good time to explore the town named Shiwei at the border and engaged in activities like horse riding, camel riding and archery.


August 20
CPS Singapore celebrated 6th anniversary in full sweat and fun at…. River Safari

Meander through the park on an exploratory river adventure of the world iconic rivers – Mississippi, Congo, Nile, Ganges, Mekong and Yangtze rivers (inspired), you can feel the cool breeze on your face, the gentle lapping of the water, rustling of the trees and chirpings of the birds – this is the River Safari exploration excursion that 120 CPS Singapore associates enjoyed with their family members on a relaxing Saturday!

Housing one of the world’s largest collection of freshwater fauna, the park features over 6,000 animals including 40 threatened species, including Singapore’s resident giant pandas – Kai Kai and Jia Jia. It was no surprise that everyone was busy catching the picture-perfect scenic photographs of the wild storks, herons, pandas, squirrels, monkeys and many other wildlife and fresh water aquarium along the way.

“It is certainly exciting and yet a great unwind from our busy city life. It was a first time for many of us. My kids love the games and adventure!”, said Elden Lim, CPS Asia MDM Manager.

“It was a great networking time because we also get to know our peers’ family members too”, agreed Katherine Gan, Office Administrator.


Fun Quiz

1. You must have read the past months’ newsletters in order to get the right answers.
2. Send only ONE entry per associate to kelzaphang@coca-cola.com.
3. Correct entries will proceed to lucky draw.
4. 5 lucky winners with the correct entries will get a prize.
5. Deadline is 23 September 2016, 5pm Singapore time.


August 25

Exclusive interview with Jina Kim, Master Production Scheduler, CPS Korea on her e-learning journey in Supply Chain Academy.

Jina joined CPS Korea in Feb 2016. Like any other young energetic girl, she dates and rides on her “musical” bike on weekends. We were impressed with her motivation to put aside time on weekends to do her e-learning and wanted to find out more from her…

Kelza : How have you benefitted from the e-learning modules in Supply Chain Academy?

Jina : I picked up practical knowledge like production output and costs analysis which I can apply in my work everyday.

Kelza : I understand that you have completed 14 modules within 6 months. How did you manage to do this in the midst of your busy schedule?

Jina : Yes, I have completed 14 modules and 3 more in progress. I plan it systematically on my weekend to do these learnings so that I can be more focused to complete 2 modules a month. I just forego 1 dinner date to complete 2 modules (wink).

Kelza : What inspire you to complete one module after another?

Jina : I see that it is an excellent opportunity for me to improve my Supply Chain knowledge through the Supply Chain Academy. I want to be a Supply Chain guru one day! I want to learn as much as I can in functions like Master Planning, Demand Planning, Logistics as well as Customer Service related knowledge. I will also not hesitate to do modules on Accounting too because finance knowledge is essential in all functions.

Kelza : What are the modules that you will recommend to your peers in CPS?

Jina : I think those that are compulsory or mandatory ones are the really good ones to start with as they are the fundamentals.

CPS Asia Newsletter
July 2016


Prestigious Achievement by CPS Japan in Fire and Disaster Management

“This is one of the most prestigious award given out by the Commissioner. We are very determined to continue our excellence in this area”, Toru Hirao, Plant Manager, CPS Japan

CPS Japan (Moriyama) was awarded by Commissioner of the Fire and Disaster Management Agency as one of the most excellent hazardous material handling facilities in Japan.

The award ceremonies was held in Tokyo on 6 June 2016. About three hundred awardees attended the ceremony. This award was the highest rank award given out so far by the Commissioner. CPS Japan is one of the few twenty-seven companies in the whole of Japan to receive this award this year. We can see the list of award recipients in the Ministry of Internal Affairs and Communication’s website. CPS Japan was highly recognized for its 40 years’ of safety operation and contribution to the local fire prevention activities. “It is a great honor to receive such award and we are determined to continue our excellence in this area”, said Toru Hirao, Plant Manager, CPS Japan.

(Contributed by Yuji Kuroda, Senior Engineering Manager, CPS Japan)

Mohamed Rozlee: Steady Amid the Spirit

“He proactively provided us solutions and was quick to our inquiries. What he has contributed was just beyond our expectation”, said I Gusti Putu Natih, Manufacturing Manager in CPS Indonesia on Rozlee’s one-month assignment in CPS Indonesia.”

Mohamed Rozlee, Production Supervisor from CPS Singapore looks extremely serious but is actually not an unfriendly person. A man of few words and expression, he is actually a warm hearted man who looks after his family well (including his wheelchair bound mum) and goes all his way out to help whenever he can.

In May, he was assigned to CPS Indonesia for a month to help the plant achieve the target production volume and ensure no quality and safety issue. “Rozlee is really a role model for all the five key leadership behaviors. He has helped us identify process inefficiency and linked us to many external expertise and resources that can help us implement best practices. We really like his steadiness and team spirit”, said Irene Subianto, Plant Manager, CPS Indonesia.

Rozlee was shy to claim any credit from this assignment. “I just want to help my Company achieve the targets and do continuous improvement. Though I miss my family, I enjoyed my time in CPS Indonesia. Thanks to the hospitality!”


July 5 – 7
Customer Relationship Management / Product Lifecycle Management Meeting in Atlanta

From left to right: Lucio José Gastaldi, Mauricio Avalos, Quentin de Menten, Richard Horkan, Geraldine Carey, Hazel Mitchell, Michel Blanchard, Nawal Jammot , Iliana Vargas, Nadina Carmenate

“Reviewing our strategies and challenges have stimulated us for greater collaboration. Collaboration which in return will reinforce our community and inspire for change“ Quentin de Menten, Business Development & Innovation Director, CPS Asia

The CRM/PLM* functional leadership team met in Atlanta for three days with the objectives to reflect on the business changes, review progress on key initiatives and agree on 2017 key focus areas, both in business and people.

During the three days meeting, the team reviewed the business priorities, shared key geographical accomplishments (in areas such as customer survey, APO customer and portfolio segmentations, commercial strategy, metrics review, business continuity plan (BCP), Supply-Chain Assessment, People Development Forum, developed a capability plan for CRM/PLM organization, revised new Tier 1 scorecard, Tier 2 and 3 leading and lagging metrics for a more customer driven approach and shared various business practices.

Key outcome was that the team agreed on actions such as developing key leading metrics to drive productivity, a plan for standard and global customer opinion survey and customer segmentation, aligning with global R&D on pipeline priorities, building the roadmap for RCG initiatives, developing the RACI for complex projects with FM, completing the CRM/PLM PDF session and designing an approach for people development.

* CRM – Customer Relationship Management
PLM – Product Lifecycle Management

International Yoga Day Celebration in CPS India

“I felt so rejuvenated after the session”, Shankar Chaple, Team Leader, Production

As a part of associate well-being program, CPS India celebrated World’s Yoga Day on 21 June 2016. Yoga is a 5,000-year-old physical, mental and spiritual practice which originated in India.

It is a type of exercise regime used by millions of people around the world to gain a healthier lifestyle. Mr. Mahdi Golara, a certified yoga instructor with eleven years of experience and also a Black Belt in Martial Arts/Karate demonstrated the benefits and basics of Yoga techniques to the associates. “Yoga has become an integral part of my life as it improved my balance, flexibility and strength”, said Rajani Hebbalkar, Customer Service Head, CPS India. Sanjay Ghatpande, Assistant Finance Manager totally agreed and added “Informative and easy to follow. I just loved it! Hope we can continue yoga sessions to maintain our well-being”.

(Contributed by Anupama Singh, Demand Analyst, CPS India)


Well- Being Enthusiasts in The North Face 100 Korea Mountain Marathon

North Face 100 Korea Mountain Marathon – enjoying the well-being moments.

Well-Being enthusiasts – Min Young Kim, Hye Jung Kim, Ga Jeon Kim and Jina Kim participated in The North Face 100 Korea Mountain Marathon on 11 June 2016 in Pyeong Chang where the Olympic Games 2018 will be held. This marathon is one of the most recognized trail running series in Asia Pacific.

“It was motivating to have one common goal with my colleagues, that was running and finishing the final line together!” Ga Jeon Kim, Warehouse Assistant Manager, CPS Korea

Well-Being Relaxation on “Grass Field”

Rest and relax plus great companionship at the Baseball Game.

Well-being need not be doing a sport nor exercise, it can just be a short great get-together watching a baseball game! This was what CPS Korea team did in July at the KT Wiz Park (15 minutes drive from the plant). The team spent a great evening lying on the baseball grass field enjoying the friendship, cheers as well as rest and relax.

(Both Articles contributed by Hye Jung Kim, Customer Service & Commercialization Manager, CPS Korea)

“We could not catch the home run ball but we definitely caught this happy moment on camera!” Jay Jeong, HR Generalist, CPS Korea


Donation Drive to the Orphanage by CPS Indonesia

The Awesome Team in Action

“I am sure the spirit of Ramadhan will continue to make us be a better person, both as an individual and a team mate in the Coca-Cola family”, said Agus Suhasdani, CPS Indonesia OE/Safety and Environment Manager.

The Month of Ramadhan falls on the period from 6 June to 6 July and is a holy month for Muslims. Muslims are, not only encouraged to increase the level of worship to God by fasting and praying, but also encouraged to donate to the poor, be kinder and more forgiving.

Gathering the Food

Part of the Donations

Breaking Fast Together

Like any other years, associates from CPS Indonesia visited the orphanage “Al-Ithqon” (which is just a stone throw away from the plant) during this holy month to spend quality time with about 70 lovely and adorable children. Realizing that the household appliances were in poor condition and that the food stock for the children were low, our associates went on a donation drive to raise fund. At the end of the event, everyone was feeling great even though exhausted. The team ended the day by breaking their fast together. “These adorable orphans deserved to be loved. We really enjoyed this moment of sharing and togetherness”, said Jani Asmarani, CPS Indonesia Administrative Assistant.


Traveling abcd
Architecture
Beautiful scenery
Culture
Dining

Jeremy Tan in Eastern Europe

Prague Old Town

Jeremy Tan, our Production Supervisor from CPS Singapore visited Romania, Montenegro, Slovenia and Czech Republic in June on a self-drive itinerary with his girlfriend. The couple travelled around different states in Romania, from Bucharest to Brasov.

“I met really warm people”

Fascinating View in Prague Old Town

Predjama Tower

Montenegro Hills of Bay of Kotor

Croatia Old Town

Brasov Square

Plitvice Lake (must go)

Skocjan Caves

Slovenia, Lake Bled

Medieval castles and Trekking were the main activities during the days. They met many warm people in Romania though they generally stay within the walls of the old town. “Tourism is one of the main drivers of the economy here. Life is slow and relaxing. Fans of the series Games Of Thrones will know this place called Dubrovnik in Croatia”. Asked him which place is a “must go”. He immediately said “the Plitvice lake”. He also love Slovenia because most of its scenic caves and castles are within mountains and Lake Bled. “One thing in Slovenia that surprised me was the weather. It was only 1 degree celcius in late Spring! I came unprepared in my Bermudas and Tees”. Czech Republic, Prague was an amazing charming city with the cobbled streets and open squares were filled with street performances”.


Fun Quiz
Guess Who ?
Who is this pretty BOY?

1. Send only ONE entry per associate to kelzaphang@coca-cola.com Please state “My answer is NAME ”
2. Correct entries will proceed to lucky draw.
3. 5 lucky winners with the correct entries will get a prize.
4. Deadline is 20 August 2016, 5pm Singapore time.

Muhammad Makshoof

Sandeep Tawale

Faisal Hashmi


Did you know that
CPS Asia Connect…
was launched on 25 July 2016?

It has a logo that is colourful. The set of colours symbolizes our vibrant personality as a team;

The rings and circles connects us through; and

The play characters symbolizes our enjoyment, happiness and fun at work.


Wiki

Eucalyptus Oil is a Miracle Oil?

Eucalyptus is known to be an excellent medicinal oil for cold, flu, sinus and allergies. Just put several drops of this essential oil into your diffuser and you can enjoy the healing benefits all night long.

This miracle oil nourishes the hair, wards off dandruff, itchy scalp and is a natural remedy for lice instead of chemical.

In addition, Eucalyptus has thousands of usage in a household. The oil not only gives a nice fresh fragrance to our home products and you cannot go wrong putting several drops into pretty much everything: soap, laundry detergent, mop water, toilet cleaner, window cleaner… the list goes on!

CPS Asia Newsletter
June 2016


Key Message from
CPS Vice President, Darlene Nicosia
after her Asia visit

“In every location, there is a real commitment to think Economic Profit act Operational Excellence…”

CPS plays a critical role in helping The Coca-Cola Company achieve success. While it’s obvious that we make the critical elements of our products, we also help to advance business objectives and achieve sustained, profitable growth for The Company. And in today’s increasingly competitive beverage industry our consumers are asking for more in terms of variety, quality, transparency and even trust from the companies that provide their favorite drinks. As a result, the way we in CPS supported the business in the past is not necessarily all it will take to support our business in the future. We need to collaborate together as a supply network so that we are able to move quickly and flexibly to support new product innovations as well as provide outstanding quality, cost and competitive advantage for our legendary brands.

I have had a chance to now visit about half of our plants and see our teams in action. In Singapore I learned about the “We Can Lah” spirit! In Shanghai it was clear the China team is focused on always doing their best and improving at every opportunity. In Japan I saw the team’s mission statement in action – “Where associates work with Pride and Joy while collaborating to ensure continuous improvement”. In every location there is a real commitment to think Economic Profit and Act Operational Excellence; and I have seen it manifested in how our teams are delivering reliable quality supply, caring for the environment through water and energy reduction efforts and the dedication to showing care for one another through behavioral based safety where peers provide real time observations to proactively identify and remove potential risks. Overall, I am impressed by the focus and commitment I see around our business each day to ensure we keep delivering our plans and thank you for your efforts to make CPS a great place to work.

Regards,
Darlene


June 16 – 17, 2016
Engaging Moments with
CPS Vice President, Darlene Nicosia
in CPS Singapore

“Great for everyone to meet Darlene and interact. It’s a rewarding experience for the team to share what they have done for continuous improvement.” said Eamiel Esguerra, Dry Parts Supervisor from CPS Singapore.

Our newly appointed Vice President for CPS, Darlene Nicosia made her first visit to Asia from Atlanta and Singapore was her first stop. Everyone was excited to have her with us.

The first day started with Darlene spending time with the CPS Asia Functional Leadership Team and ending her day with female associates, gracing as guest of honor in the Women’s LINC Red Heels event.

The second day was a plant tour day for Darlene. She was accompanied by Maeve Lynch, the Plant Manager for CPS Singapore. She was first brought to view the construction progress of the New ASRS project before proceeding to the production floor. Via the Dumping, Filling and Kitting for Dry Part, Batching to Filling for Liquid, QA, Receiving and Shipping Warehouse. The team shared with her the Ty-Guild and Ty Bag project, SWAT and Ops. Value Stream Mapping projects to improve machine up time, productivity & reduces expenses. Having received great compliments from Darlene on our DMAIC methodology and OE tools used through the plant, the team is highly motivated to seek continuous improvement in these areas. The plant town hall session was filled with interesting questions and laughter followed by cake cutting for the birthday celebrations. She is such an approachable and people-oriented leader. We look forward to her leadership & experience that she will bring to CPS.

(Contributed by Phang Kum Kong, OE Manager, CPS Singapore)


June 27, 2016
Interactive Dialogue Sessions with
CPS Vice President, Darlene Nicosia
in CPS Shanghai

Darlene Nicosia visited CPS Shanghai on June 27 accompanied by Ruddy Sterckx, our CPS Asia General Manager. That awesome day started with a general orientation of the plant followed by a talent dialogue with 11 leaders. In a town hall session, Darlene shared her leadership journey, emphasizing “growth mindset” that left a deep impression on the associates.

The session was interactive with open discussions and dialogues on career advancement, leadership, Operational Excellence culture and also on risks and opportunities for the business. The plant tour took place in both CPS Shanghai and PBF facilities later in the day where our frontline operators shared the daily operational processes to both Darlene and Ruddy.

(Contributed by Frances Shao, Executive Assistant, CPS Shanghai)


June 30, 2016
Enriching Experiences and Learning with
CPS Vice President, Darlene Nicosia
in CPS Japan, Moriyama

We are honored to have our visiting guests, Darlene Nicosia (CPS Vice President), Nemesio Diez (Technical Capability Director), Ben Johnston (Senior HR Director, Technical and CPS) and Ruddy Sterckx (CPS Asia General Manager) with us for a dinner with the Plant Leadership Team @ The Sodoh on 29 June evening.

The day 30 June started with Darlene, Nemesio, Ben and Ruddy visiting CPS Moriyama where they were given full familiarity to the plant’s operational processes and excellence. In the afternoon after lunch, Mr M. Iguchi led the group on a thorough R&D Pilot Laboratory tour. The town hall session was lighthearted with interesting and engaging dialogues. All associates were deeply impressed by Darlene’s work philosophy and personal values. The day ended well with Darlene shared her career progression, life challenges and valuable experiences at the Women’s LINC session. The women felt empowered in many ways and were highly motivated by her passion in both personal and work life.

(Contributed by Toru Hirao, Plant Manager, CPS Japan)

CPS Global Leadership Team Meeting in Atlanta

“Thanks to everyone…”

The CPS global Leadership Team had the first meeting from June 6 – 12 with Darlene Nicosia, the newly appointed Vice President for CPS. Darlene who joined CPS from the Global Sustainable Procurement team was warmly welcomed by the team.

It was a great opportunity to evaluate the 2016 performance and look ahead at 2017 expectations. With the work on Regional Standards for 2017 at full steam, everyone sees a challenging environment for next year and are working hard to be ready for discussions with the Business Units in August.

The meeting was joined by guest speaker, Dennis Ryan who spoke about “Renewing Category Growth”, a key initiative for Coca-Cola. This initiative wants to address concerns around some ingredients in our soft drinks and has 5 action pillars namely “Shape choice”, “Innovate”, “Promote clear facts”, “Market responsibly” and “Lead engagement”.

The team also visited the Atlanta Beverage Base plant where Bryan Weaver and his team hosted an interesting plant tour. Overall there was great progress in a number of key discussions in this first meeting under Darlene’s leadership. Plans were already set for more discussions in September in Pune. Stay tuned!

(Contributed by Ruddy Sterckx, CPS Asia General Manager)

“In the midst of various challenges, our 2016 plans for CPS are holding strong and our commitment on Operating Income is still intact. For Asia, the current picture of “Risks and Opportunities” is also still pointing towards delivering our contribution for that target. Thanks to every-one in CPS Asia for this!” said Ruddy Sterckx, CPS Asia General Manager.

Everyone had great fun searching for clues to locate the key that would unlock a closed room in which a zombie, tied on a chain that extended every few minutes, was trying to “kill” them!


Integrated Management Systems Certification Achievement by CPS Singapore

CPS Singapore achieved the re-certification for our Integrated Management Systems (ISO 9001, ISO 14001, FSSC 22000, OHSAS 18001) on June 15-17. There were in total 8 auditors from SGS covering the scope of the audit within three days.

This was the first time we have a four system audit at a go. It was certainly tougher but the good side was it actually reduced the number of audits the Plant needs to manage annually. The success of this audit is a reflection of the strong support from the Plant associates and this was cited by the SGS as a positive trait of our people’s commitment to the effectiveness of the management systems. This intensive audit has brought about some learnings for the core team on how to better manage the flow for the next audit.

Quality, Safety and Environment Campaign – STEP-UP!

The CPS Singapore annual QSE Campaign was held on 23 May to promote awareness in the areas of Quality, Safety and Environment among Plant associates. The theme for this year’s campaign is “STEP-UP.” “Step-up” signifies continual improvement on top of the basic requirements pertaining to QSE. The areas of focus were GMP, Pest Control and PPE. Short presentations on the topic with a live demonstration of proper gowning were conducted, followed by interactive games to reinforce associates’ learnings. Associates were required to complete all stations to obtain stamps on their coupons in order to spin the Wheel of Treats and to win a special token of appreciation.

(Contributed by Gabriel Ng, Process QA Manager, CPS Singapore)


Behavioral Based Safety (BBS) in Korea

Behavioral Based Safety (BBS) Step 6 and Step 7 were successfully completed in CPS Korea from June 13 to 17 with support from Aphichat Boonruangthaworn from CPS Asia, Azumi Kobayashi from CPS Japan and Ahmed Waqar from CPS Pakistan.

During that week, trainings done for the 7 new observers. The teams also completed:

– BBS Process quality review with Process index, Action planning with data review
– Barrier removal and action planning (Theory + Practice)
– BBS implementation review for CPS Pakistan

The team had a great learning and interactive session.

(Contributed by June Young Kim, Engineering & ESLP Manager, CPS Korea)

GOLD is a feeling that our CPS Ambassador Asra Farooq can taste

..eat good, look good, do good”

Asra Farooq, Process QA Specialist from CPS Pakistan is our CPS Well-Being Champion! A highly motivated lady who knows how to live life, you will not be surprised that she has not only beaten many associates to obtain the highest votes in CPS, she has also secured the 5th position in the Olympic Steps Challenge.

She takes good step to achieve her well-being goals emotionally, socially, physically and financially. Leading a simple life by practicing yoga and aerobics, she is always ever ready to help others in need, inspire people around her. “I invest wisely to build assets and am careful in my spending but I make sure that I eat good, look good and do good!” When asked how she will encourage others to take care of their well-being, she said immediately with a big smile, “By extending support to others to develop their well-being goals, motivate people around by leading as an example and celebrating each other’s successes. I am thankful to Coca-Cola for this Well-Being initiative. I met many new AWB champions and learnt so much from them. I am excited about my trip to Rio in August!”

I must say that it was really a pleasure communicating with Asra in the past weeks. I never thought a 28-year old lady will have this level of maturity. I really look forward to hearing from her again on her trip to Rio. Let’s look out for her news in Septembe… see ya

“well-being is a journey.

ENJOY IT. LOVE IT”


Iftar
Dinner
Together…

One of the Well-Being activities and in celebration of the holy month of Ramadan, Team Coca-Cola Pakistan came together to share happiness at Iftar (the meal eaten by Muslims after sunset during Ramadan). The Iftar dinner was held at the Nishat hotel in Lahore, amidst a festive Ramadan atmosphere. This evening celebration allowed all associates to connect with each other, meet new colleagues and share in the Ramadan spirit. The Iftar was attended by Region Office and CPS Plant associates, as well as their spouses and was greatly enjoyed by all.

“Ramadan is a holy & spiritual month, with a general atmosphere of respect and positivity. We are committed to enable all of our employees to come together during this special time and enjoy it with one another.” said Rizwan Khan, General Manager of Pakistan Region.

Coca-Cola Middle Pakistan wishes its employees a blessed Ramadan filled with continued success and prosperity on both the professional and personal levels.

Contributed by Faisal Hashmi, Strategic HR Business Partner, CPS Pakistan)


Do you have a healthy Body Mass Index ?

The following are BMI standards in Singapore, may differ slightly from other countries. This guide is not for anyone

“Healthy BMI means Least Health Problems”

Body Mass Index (BMI), is defined as the individual’s body mass divided by the square of his or her height.

BMI is a heuristic proxy for human body fat based on an individual’s weight and height, though it does not actually measure the percentage of body fat you have in your body. Since BMI takes into account your whole body weight, a person could fall in the overweight category but have a low body fat percentage. This occurs because muscle weighs much more than fat. Therefore, you might pack a lot of muscle and very little fat and still top the scales, which results in you being classified as overweight, even though you actually have so much less body fat than the average person.

Sun Wha Chung
in Barcelona & Sevilla

“Enjoy wine, beer, COKE, Jamon, steak, foie gras and Tapas as much as you can!”

Sun Wha Chung, Assistant Planning Manager from CPS Korea visited Barcelona and Sevilla (Spain) for 9 days with her husband, Jwaho Kim.

Barcelona, a cosmopolitan capital of Spain’s Catalonia region is defined by renowning architecture, imaginative food and vibrant street life. No wonder Sun Wha Chung was so excited talking about it. “You cannot talk about Barcelona without Gaudi’s Architecture!” Gaudi is famous for his iconic architecture including the famous La Sagrada Familia Basilica, Park Güell, Casa Batlló and Casa Milá. “The Palace of Catalan Music by the architect Lluís Domènech i Montaner is also another amazing architect in Barcelona. I could enjoy Vienna Philiharmonic in this palace.”

The couple took a 2-hour domestic flight from Barcelona to visit Sevilla, a city in Southern Spain and a capital in Andalusia region. Sevilla is a hotbed for flamenco dance in the Triana neighbourhood and is known for its ornate Alcazar castle complex, built in the 18th century.

“Other than the rain, everything was fantastic! It is best to go on free and easy where your time is flexible to savor different food and understand the culture. We experienced great fine dining and interesting shopping in Boqueria Market, another must-go place!”. When asked if she will revisit the place, Sun Wha Chung said that she is already making sure her hubby is saving up now explore other parts of Spain!

La Sagrada Familia Basilica

Plaza de Espana (Spain Square)

Street of Sevilla in front of Alcazar

“…best to go on Free & Easy”

Sean Siew
me & my baby

Sean’s first experience as a real DAD

It was rather difficult to get an appointment with Sean Siew, our Production Scheduler from CPS Singapore. He was never free and we had to cancel our appointment several times. Reason? He was just back from his leaves. It was not just an ordinary period of leaves but he has taken time off to do another important job – baby sitting.

Life is more intense for him with the arrival of his first born, Jensen Siew. He was captivated by this little additional member that everything else in life is secondary. “Every day the couple has to work out the baby’s needs. Sean used to meet his friends about 4 times a month but with Jensen around, he has cut down to once a month. “I just have to say goodbye to our private time and social life but Jensen brought the family closer”. When asked what is Jensen’s personality like, he said with a laugh “Cranky and Playful. He keeps moving non-stop!”

“I actually felt the greatness of my parents for bringing me up and so I want to express my thanks to them for taking care of me all these years.”

“my Responsibility is TO LOVE YOU”

CPS Pakistan’s
BIRTHDAY BASH
May 10, 2016

Coca-Cola Pakistan celebrated 130th Coca-Cola day with great joy and fun. Everyone was jubilantly high in their spirit and the mood was exuberant. “This magical feeling continues for 130 years. Every moment spent with Coco-cola was with feelings of great enthusiasm, passion, happiness and optimism. We experienced these feelings and tasted these feelings on this special day!” said Muhd Makshoof, Plant Manager, CPS Pakistan.

“This magical feeling continues for 130 years…” (Muhd Makshoof)


CPS Singapore celebrates

on May 23, 2016

It was a half day employee appreciation event where associates were treated specially to a movie screening in the downtown of Singapore. “It was such a happy experience to have time off and watch movie with colleagues. Indeed a wonderful way to celebrate 130 years of Coca-Cola!” feedbacked Shirley Anne Caparas, Snr Accountant CPS Singapore. “Great movie with great company. What more could we ask for? Now, it is our responsibility to carry this legacy forward through quality of the products and serving our customers well. Let’s be at our best everyday!” said Sandeep Boralkar, Plant Manager, CPS India.

The Environment, Safety, Loss, Prevention (ESLP) Workshop was held in CPS Singapore from April 19 to 21

The team comprising more than 10 members updated the ESLP initiatives including best practices and challenges, reflected on the QSE transformation journey, dived deep into raising the bar in our ESLP compliances & governance, discussed the active use of EJT tools to capture all the potential productivity initiatives, reviewed the outcome of the voice survey of Q4, 2015 and made great efforts to further enhance the safety and sustainability training for our employees.

“We shared the best practices & challenges from each plant. Key outcomes was not just a great set of action points to follow up on but each of us took back a lot of essential learnings for our personal growth,” commented Hoon Kim, CPS Asia QSE Director.

ST E P
SUPERVISORY TRAINING FOR EXCELLENT PERFORMANCE

“Inspiring leaders & now is time for me to inspire & motivate our people!” said Jin Dokgo, OE/IMS Manager, CPS Korea

Supervisory Training for Excellent Performance (STEP) is a frontline people leadership development program which was launched in CPS Asia since October 2015 in collaboration with BIG and global learning partners.

The STEP program has been specifically designed to strengthen the capabilities of Frontline People Managers, as we believe that their success in managing self, managing others and managing the business are crucial in ensuring our frontline teams to effectively execute their day-to-day responsibilities & help achieve our 2020 vision. The program is conducted in 2 sessions over a period of 4 to 6 months.

Weather so hot!
What can I do?

When the weather is too hot, you may feel sick and experience heavy sweating, weakness, confused, dizziness, nausea, headache, fast heartbeat, dark color urine (indicates dehydration).

What should I do if I think I have heat exhaustion?
– get out of the heat quickly, get indoor
– rest in air-conditioning or shady place
– cool, shady place
– drink plenty of water or fluids
– do NOT drink alcohol
– take a cool shower or bath or spray water on skin
– wear light clothing & avoid tight ones

See a doctor if condition does not improve after doing the above, before it can progress to heatstroke. Heatstroke is much more serious than heat exhaustion. Heatstroke can cause damage to your organs and brain. In extreme cases, it can kill. So, please ensure you are hydrated at all times.
